summary: The diff adds a full React landing page with required sections, feature cards, dashboard mockup previews, analytics charts, face-attendance concept demo, interactive admissions + chatbot demos, and a contact form wired to a Motoko backend method. However, some acceptance criteria are not evidenced (notably prefers-reduced-motion support and the presence of the required generated image files under public/assets/generated). The diff also introduces several backend/user-profile/access-control features not requested in the BuildRequest.

missing_requirements.requirement: Section transitions / element entrances include subtle smooth animations without harming performance or accessibility (prefers-reduced-motion respected).
missing_requirements.reason: Animations are added via classes like animate-fade-in / animate-slide-in-left, but there is no evidence of prefers-reduced-motion handling (e.g., motion-reduce variants or CSS media query) in the provided diff summary.

missing_requirements.requirement: All required generated image assets exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are used in the relevant sections.
missing_requirements.reason: UI references the required image paths under /assets/generated, but the diff summary does not show the actual PNG files being added (they may be among omitted files). Existence cannot be confirmed from the provided diff summary.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend user profile management (get/save caller profile, admin-restricted profile access).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asked for persisting contact form submissions; user profile APIs were not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend access control/authorization system initialization and secret-token-based initialization path on the frontend actor hook.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest did not request admin token initialization, authorization mixins, or permission-gated admin APIs beyond a simple contact submission/listing interface.
Not requested by the BuildRequest (footer requirements were social links + standard metadata).
